intro: Afroknoxia, commonly known as the African knoxia, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to various regions of sub-Saharan Africa, where it thrives in dry, arid environments. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow or white. Afroknoxia species are often found in rocky or sandy soils, showcasing their adaptability to harsh climates. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
